value.title: Power BI Helper Version 12 Jan 2021 Feature Summary
value.excerpt: Happy New Year. We wish this be a year full of happiness and joy for all of you. We are glad to let you know that version 12 of Power BI Helper is now available to download with the below new features;  Detecting the storage mode of tables (DirectQuery, Dual, Import) Detecting the connection mode of

value.title: Power BI Is Too Much for One Person   Roles in the Power BI Development
value.excerpt: Power BI is a tool that you can get started working with it in a few hours, but to use it in its full potential, these days, you require to have many skills. The variety of solutions and BI implementations is also dictating to have different roles, positions, jobs in the Power BI development market.

value.title: Power BI Licensing Walk through Guide
value.excerpt: Licensing in Power BI is not a complicated one, however, understanding that which features are included in which licensing plan is always a question from users. In this post, you will learn about all different licensing plans in Power BI, the scenarios to use the licensing for, and scenarios that you

value.title: Power BI Quick Tip: the Formula Bar in Power Query
value.excerpt: Often you do the transformation in Power Query using the graphical interface, but having the formula bar visible, makes it much easier to understand or change the transformations. In this short blog and video, I'll explain that. read my blog with more details here: https://radacad.com/power-bi-quick-tip-the-formula-bar-in-power-query

value.title: Power BI User Access Levels   Build and Edit are different
value.excerpt: Often I have seen Power BI users have access to the areas that they shouldn’t. In Power BI, you can share a report with a user just for view only, or give them access to view and built, or to Edit. These are all different levels of access. Build access is the one that is often is confused with Edit.

value.title: Relationship Based on Multiple Fields in Power BI Using TREATAS DAX Function
value.excerpt: TreatAs is helpful for filtering, and it doesn't filter only based on one column, it can filter based on as many as columns you want. value.title: Relative Date Slicer for Your Local Time Zone in Power BI
value.excerpt: If you have used the relative date slicer and you are not living at a timezone close to UTC, then you have seen that the Power BI Date slicer is not much of a use, because you have to still adjust it with your local time zone. value.title: Remove Duplicate Does not Work in Power Query for Power BI Here is the Solution

value.title: Take Your Power BI Visualization to the Next Level using Small Multiples
value.excerpt: Small multiple is a relatively recent feature on some of the Power BI visuals. There are many situations that you get a name, value data source, and wants to convert that into columns with values underneath. value.title: What is Premium Per User License for Power BI, and What is it good for
value.excerpt: One of the great news in Microsoft Ignite 2020 is the announcement of a new licensing plan for Microsoft Power BI, called Premium Per User, or Premium Gen2. In this article, I'll explain what that is, and how this can be helpful for Power BI users. Read my article here to find links to study more: https://radacad.com/what-is-premium-per-user-license-for-power-bi-and-what-is-it-good-for

value.title: Applying color banding by document number in Power BI

value.title: DIVIDE Performance
value.excerpt: The DIVIDE function in DAX is usually faster to avoid division-by-zero errors than the simple division operator. However, there are exceptions to this rule, described in this video through simple performance analysis. Article and download: https://sql.bi/15381?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Sorting months in fiscal calendars in DAX
